lead_paragraph: SUPPLEE--Cochran B.,a retired Manhattan corporate communications executive, died on July 14, 2016 at his home in Santa Barbara, CA. After attending Choate and Princeton University he enlisted in the Army, training with the Colorado ski troops and emerging as an army lieutenant. He married Angela Toland Place In 1946 and they resided in Manhattan and their summer home In Millbrook, NY. He received his MBA from NYU and divided his career between advertising and corporate relations at the former Cluett Peabody Company, maker of Arrow shirts. Mr. Supple was very active in promoting and supporting the activities of the Boy's Club of New York serving as a trustee prior to his retirement. He was also a member of The Century Association and the St. Nicholas Society in New York City. He is survived by his wife, of over half a century, Angela P. Supplee and their daughter Angela S. Chesser, Ph.D. in Columbus, OH. Memorial donations may be sent to St. Peter's Church, PO Box 1502, Millbrook, NY 12545. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SUPPLEE, COCHRAN B.
